briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to rot, and clears the translation.
Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to rot, without clearing the translation.
Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to rot, and clears the translation.
Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to rot, without clearing the translation.
Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to mx, and clears the translation.
Sets the matrix to specify a rotation equivalent to mx, without clearing the translation.
Sets the matrix to specify a nonuniform scaling in x, y, and z by the factors in vector scaleFactors.
Sets matrix to specify a translation by the vector trans, and clears the rotation.
Sets matrix to specify a translation by the vector trans, without clearing the rotation.
Sets matrix to specify a rotation by rotate and a translation by translate.
Sets matrix to specify a rotation by rotmx and a translation by translate.
Sets the matrix to specify a viewing matrix from parameters similar to those used by gluLookAt(3G).

detaileddescription.para: eyePoint represents the eye point in world space. centerPoint represents the world-space center of attention. upDirection is a vector indicating which way is up.

briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix to specify a viewing matrix from a world-space eyePoint and a world-space rotation that rigidly rotates the orientation from its canonical frame, which is defined to be looking along the -z axis with the +y axis as the up direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (GfMatrix4d *r, GfVec3d *s, GfMatrix4d *u, GfVec3d *t, GfMatrix4d *p, double eps=1e-10) const
memberdef.name: Factor

briefdescription.para: Factors the matrix into 5 components:

detaileddescription.para:
M = r * s * -r * u * t where
t is a translation.
u and r are rotations, and -r is the transpose (inverse) of r. The u matrix may contain shear information.
s is a scale. Any projection information could be returned in matrix p, but currently p is never modified.
Returns false if the matrix is singular (as determined by eps). In that case, any zero scales in s are clamped to eps to allow computation of u.

briefdescription.para: Returns the translation part of the matrix, defined as the first three elements of the last row.
Returns the rotation corresponding to this matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This works well only if the matrix represents a rotation.
For good results, consider calling Orthonormalize() before calling this method.

briefdescription.para: Return the rotation corresponding to this matrix as a quaternion.

detaileddescription.para: This works well only if the matrix represents a rotation.
For good results, consider calling Orthonormalize() before calling this method.

memberdef.argsstring: (const GfVec3d &axis0, const GfVec3d &axis1, const GfVec3d &axis2) const
memberdef.name: DecomposeRotation

briefdescription.para: Decompose the rotation corresponding to this matrix about 3 orthogonal axes.

detaileddescription.para: If the axes are not orthogonal, warnings will be spewed.
This is a convenience method that is equivalent to calling ExtractRotation().Decompose().

briefdescription.para: Returns the rotation corresponding to this matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This works well only if the matrix represents a rotation.
For good results, consider calling Orthonormalize() before calling this method.

briefdescription.para: Transforms the row vector vec by the matrix, returning the result.

detaileddescription.para: This treats the vector as a 4-component vector whose fourth component is 1.

briefdescription.para: Transforms the row vector vec by the matrix, returning the result.

detaileddescription.para: This treats the vector as a 4-component vector whose fourth component is 1. This is an overloaded method; it differs from the other version in that it returns a different value type.

briefdescription.para: Transforms row vector vec by the matrix, returning the result.

detaileddescription.para: This treats the vector as a direction vector, so the translation information in the matrix is ignored. That is, it treats the vector as a 4-component vector whose fourth component is 0.

briefdescription.para: Transforms row vector vec by the matrix, returning the result.

detaileddescription.para: This treats the vector as a direction vector, so the translation information in the matrix is ignored. That is, it treats the vector as a 4-component vector whose fourth component is 0. This is an overloaded method; it differs from the other version in that it returns a different value type.

briefdescription.para: Transforms the row vector vec by the matrix, returning the result.

detaileddescription.para: This treats the vector as a 4-component vector whose fourth component is 1 and ignores the fourth column of the matrix (i.e. assumes it is (0, 0, 0, 1)).

briefdescription.para: Transforms the row vector vec by the matrix, returning the result.

detaileddescription.para: This treats the vector as a 4-component vector whose fourth component is 1 and ignores the fourth column of the matrix (i.e. assumes it is (0, 0, 0, 1)).

briefdescription.para: Matrix storage, in row-major order.
Hash.
Returns the product of a matrix and a double.
Returns the unary negation of matrix m.
Adds matrix m2 to m1.
Subtracts matrix m2 from m1.
Multiplies matrix m1 by m2.
Divides matrix m1 by m2 (that is, m1 * inv(m2)).
Returns the product of a matrix m and a column vector vec.
Returns the product of row vector vec and a matrix m.
Returns the product of a matrix m and a column vector vec.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the return type is a GfVec4f.

briefdescription.para: Returns the product of row vector vec and a matrix m.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the return type is a GfVec4f.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor. Leaves the matrix component values undefined.

memberdef.argsstring: (double m00, double m01, double m02, double m03, double m10, double m11, double m12, double m13, double m20, double m21, double m22, double m23, double m30, double m31, double m32, double m33)
memberdef.name: GfMatrix4d

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the matrix from 16 independent double values, specified in row-major order. For example, parameter m10 specifies the value in row 1 and column 0.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the matrix from a 4x4 array of double values, specified in row-major order.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Explicitly initializes the matrix to s times the identity matrix.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Explicitly initializes the matrix to diagonal form, with the i th element on the diagonal set to v[i].

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the matrix from a vector of vectors of double. The vector is expected to be 4x4. If it is too big, only the first 4 rows and/or columns will be used. If it is too small, uninitialized elements will be filled in with the corresponding elements from an identity matrix.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the matrix from a vector of vectors of float. The vector is expected to be 4x4. If it is too big, only the first 4 rows and/or columns will be used. If it is too small, uninitialized elements will be filled in with the corresponding elements from an identity matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< double > &r0, const std::vector< double > &r1, const std::vector< double > &r2, const std::vector< double > &r3)
memberdef.name: GfMatrix4d

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the matrix from 4 row vectors of double. Each vector is expected to length 4. If it is too big, only the first 4 items will be used. If it is too small, uninitialized elements will be filled in with the corresponding elements from an identity matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< float > &r0, const std::vector< float > &r1, const std::vector< float > &r2, const std::vector< float > &r3)
memberdef.name: GfMatrix4d

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the matrix from 4 row vectors of float. Each vector is expected to length 4. If it is too big, only the first 4 items will be used. If it is too small, uninitialized elements will be filled in with the corresponding elements from an identity matrix.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes a transformation matrix to perform the indicated rotation and translation.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes a transformation matrix to perform the indicated rotation and translation.

briefdescription.para: This explicit constructor converts a "float" matrix to a "double" matrix.
Sets a row of the matrix from a Vec4.
Sets a column of the matrix from a Vec4.
Gets a row of the matrix as a Vec4.
Gets a column of the matrix as a Vec4.

memberdef.argsstring: (double m00, double m01, double m02, double m03, double m10, double m11, double m12, double m13, double m20, double m21, double m22, double m23, double m30, double m31, double m32, double m33)
memberdef.name: Set

briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix from 16 independent double values, specified in row-major order.

detaileddescription.para: For example, parameter m10 specifies the value in row 1 and column 0.

briefdescription.para: Sets the matrix from a 4x4 array of double values, specified in row-major order.
Sets the matrix to the identity matrix.
Sets the matrix to zero.
Sets the matrix to s times the identity matrix.
Sets the matrix to have diagonal (v[0], v[1], v[2], v[3]).
Fills a 4x4 array of double values with the values in the matrix, specified in row-major order.
Returns raw access to components of matrix as an array of double values.

detaileddescription.para: Components are in row-major order.

briefdescription.para: Returns const raw access to components of matrix as an array of double values.

detaileddescription.para: Components are in row-major order.

briefdescription.para: Returns vector components as an array of double values.
Returns vector components as a const array of double values.
Accesses an indexed row i of the matrix as an array of 4 double values so that standard indexing (such as m[0][1]) works correctly.
Accesses an indexed row i of the matrix as an array of 4 double values so that standard indexing (such as m[0][1]) works correctly.
Tests for element-wise matrix equality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Tests for element-wise matrix equality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Tests for element-wise matrix inequality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Tests for element-wise matrix inequality.

detaileddescription.para: All elements must match exactly for matrices to be considered equal.

briefdescription.para: Returns the transpose of the matrix.
Returns the inverse of the matrix, or FLT_MAX * SetIdentity() if the matrix is singular.

detaileddescription.para: (FLT_MAX is the largest value a float can have, as defined by the system.) The matrix is considered singular if the determinant is less than or equal to the optional parameter eps. If det is non-null, *det is set to the determinant.

briefdescription.para: Returns the determinant of the matrix.
Sets a row of the matrix from a Vec3.

detaileddescription.para: The fourth element of the row is ignored.

briefdescription.para: Gets a row of the matrix as a Vec3.
Returns the determinant of the upper 3x3 matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This method is useful when the matrix describes a linear transformation such as a rotation or scale because the other values in the 4x4 matrix are not important.

briefdescription.para: Returns true, if the row vectors of the upper 3x3 matrix form an orthogonal basis.

detaileddescription.para: Note they do not have to be unit length for this test to return true.

briefdescription.para: Makes the matrix orthonormal in place.

detaileddescription.para: This is an iterative method that is much more stable than the previous cross/cross method. If the iterative method does not converge, a warning is issued.

Returns true if the iteration converged, false otherwise. Leaves any translation part of the matrix unchanged. If issueWarning is true, this method will issue a warning if the iteration does not converge, otherwise it will be silent.

briefdescription.para: Returns an orthonormalized copy of the matrix.
Returns the sign of the determinant of the upper 3x3 matrix, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: 1 for a right-handed matrix, -1 for a left-handed matrix, and 0 for a singular matrix.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the vectors in the upper 3x3 matrix form a right-handed coordinate system.
Returns true if the vectors in the upper 3x3 matrix form a left-handed coordinate system.
Post-multiplies matrix m into this matrix.
Multiplies the matrix by a double.
Adds matrix m to this matrix.
Subtracts matrix m from this matrix.
Sets matrix to specify a uniform scaling by scaleFactor.
Returns the matrix with any scaling or shearing removed, leaving only the rotation and translation.

detaileddescription.para: If the matrix cannot be decomposed, returns the original matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t row1, size_t row2, size_t row3, size_t col1, size_t col2, size_t col3) const
memberdef.name: _GetDeterminant3

briefdescription.para: Returns the determinant of the 3x3 submatrix specified by the three given row and column indices (0-3 for each).
Diagonalizes the upper 3x3 matrix of a matrix known to be symmetric.
Set the 3x3 submatrix to the rotation given by a quaternion, defined by the real component r and imaginary components i.
Stores a 4x4 matrix of double elements.

detaileddescription.para: A basic type.
Matrices are defined to be in row-major order, so matrix[i][j] indexes the element in the i th row and the j th column.

The following methods interpret a GfMatrix4d as a 3D transformation: SetRotate(), SetScale(), SetTranslate(), SetLookAt(), Factor(), ExtractTranslation(), ExtractRotation(), Transform(), TransformDir(). By convention, vectors are treated primarily as row vectors, implying the following:
Transformation matrices are organized to deal with row vectors, not column vectors. For example, the last row of a matrix contains the translation amounts.
Each of the Set() methods below completely rewrites the matrix; for example, SetTranslate() yields a matrix which does nothing but translate.
When multiplying two transformation matrices, the matrix on the left applies a more local transformation to a row vector. For example, if R represents a rotation matrix and T represents a translation matrix, the product R*T will rotate a row vector, then translate it.
